FuncDef:
The active port-basic command activates interface-specific basic hardware licenses.
The undo active port-basic command deactivates interface-specific basic hardware licenses.
By default, the interface-specific basic hardware licenses is deactivate.
CLIs: undo active port-basic slot <slotid> card <cardid> [ port <port-list> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a controlled subcard.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the port list mapped to the license type on a subcard.
The value is a string, the length of the string ranges from 1 to 256.

Specifies the slot ID of a controlled board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: Info: Use the display command to check the activation status of the port-basic licenses after committing the command.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To properly use interfaces, you must activate interface-specific basic hardware licenses. If the licenses are not activated, the interface bandwidth is limited, and the enhanced hardware licenses of other services fail to be activated. To activate interface-specific basic hardware licenses, run the active port-basic command. You can deactivate interface-specific basic hardware licenses either for a single interface or for a batch of interfaces on a specified subcard.
Precautions
This command applies only to boards in CM mode.This command cannot be run if the specified board/subcard is offline.This command applies only to the Admin-VS.For E1 subcards in CM mode, if the basic hardware license is not activated or no resource is available after the activation, the channel-set or using e1 command is limited to create the serial interface. When you run this command to activate basic hardware licenses on the interface and the system has available basic hardware licenses on the interface, the basic hardware status of the interface can be changed to activated and the channel-set or using e1 command can be executed normally.
